intro: Astragalus egglestonii, commonly known as the Eggleston milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. This species is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, growing in sandy or gravelly soils. Astragalus egglestonii is a perennial plant that plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Its limited distribution makes it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
